page.title: 13Farming Part 2
page.content: The farmer follows a similar pattern with each of the crops he grows. First he prepares the land by ploughing, then he sows the seeds. He puts fertilizer and pesticide on the field. These protect the crops from attack by insects and moulds. As the crop grows he puts a growth regulator on. This stops the crop growing so tall that it falls over. Then he waits for it to ripen. When it is ready the crop is harvested by machine and processed into it's final product. Wheat is turned into flour and made into bread and cakes, barley and triticale are used in the brewing process or used as animal food, the oil is extracted from rape and used as vegetable oil in cooking, potatoes are used as a food crop for either animals or humans and sugar-beet is taken into Peterborough where the sugar is extracted.
